page.title: 12HUNTWICK GRANGE
page.content: {Huntwick Grange}between{Featherstone and{Wakefield}dates back to the sixteenth century and its original owner is reputed to have gone to America on the{Mayflower}in 1620. The present owner of the Grange ,Mr Driffield, has owned the Grange for twenty eight years. Inside the Grange there are nine rooms all of a fair size. He has five people working for him on the farm and he and his son also work. Mr Driffield farms 1000 acres of land which is rented from{Nostell {Priory}and the{N.C.B}Like many farmers in our area,he is concerned with{dairy farming}and he has 350 head of dairy cattle and 450{beef cattle. The milk produced goes to Northern Dairies at Wakefield and the beef cattle go to a slaughterhouse at Huddersfield.
